Articles.Content:
Have to figure out CKAN integration, too

If it's on KerbalStuff, as long as you didn't uncheck the CKAN checkbox when creating the mod listing, it should get added to CKAN eventually without you needing to do anything. On the CKAN side, KerbalStuff automatically sends the request, but someone on the CKAN side has to manually add it, I think.

This is a beautifully modeled vehicle and should be an example to the community of what is possible when professional grade techniques are applied to a project from start to finish.

Chaka the monkey offers his "5 monkey paw stamps" rating of excellence!

Edited September 12, 2015 by YANFRET

Hey all, thanks for the nice words!

Just want to say, I had a conversation with Dragon01 and he gave some interesting feedback. Based on this, the next (or one of the next^^) update(s) will change the second stage RD-0210, as it will be converted into 4 single physical engines instead of acting like beeing one big engine with multiple nozzles. So Mods lile TestFlight might influence a single engine instead of one whole blob of them.
Superb quality, there are no words, you are a genius !!!
Really clean. Congrats.
This mod is awesome. It looks so good and its surprisingly light on resources.
Thanks. Let me know if you have issues. I'm working on some Payload and the Launchclamps. Fairings will be see-trough in VAB, too.
what types of payload? comm sats and the like?
First one will be a TKS/VA. I just like that ship. And I want to explore how to make an IVA.
Alright, just found this. Looking forward to giving it a try!

Fantastic detail.. Makes a fine addition to my RO real launchers collection  

Good job!

Hey Guys,

just wanted to say that the mod is alive and kicking. Slowly but steady. Clamps are done researching and modelling, just need to AO bake and texture then and export everything. Don't know if I make one arm without fuel line, which is used on the side of the launch table where the rocket is loaded. Probably will do. With the clamps will come the update for the Rocket itself, like see-through fairings in VAB, smaller tweaks, like said before. Also, TKS/VA is coming along nicely.

(fast preview render of clamps WIP with the most basic materials)

Edited January 19, 2016 by InsaneDruid

hey, druid, may I please suggest that you alter your mod's title (sorry, thread title) to indicate which KSP version this mod is presently compatible with?  May be helpful for people looking for compatible mods.
Giving this a whirl right now. Kinda throwing it together based off how I think it works... we'll see if I'm understanding it right in a few minutes!

OK, had some time to experiment with this...

OP is definitely the word I'd use for this thing. But, in my opinion, there is no such thing in KSP. Merely high-performance. 

That said, MechJeb's Ascent Autopilot does NOT take kindly to the first stage. It can't seem to access the gimbals on the engines.
I did notice the absurd power. To get a 10.7 ton payload to geostationary from kosmodrome (bikanour) with the absurd plane change that entails only required the second stage.

Yeah she packs quite a punch. Problem is though: if you build a stack the size of the proton from 2.5 and 1.25m stock parts you will get roughtly the same amount of fuel, oxidizer and mass, as the parts use the same rules for density and volume. So far, so good. But then, you need the engines to be as powerfull as they are to lift that thing. Soo.. ISP would be a place to attack the problem and cut her down a bit in terms of op-ness in the stock environment. But then, I am already lower on thrust, isp, burntime and dv than tantaresLV proton. Or arbitrarily increase the mass of the engines, like all stock parts have? Hmmm...^^

Edited January 27, 2016 by InsaneDruid

Never said the OPness was a bad thing.

That said, any ideas why I can't get much pitch authority? I have the KM_Gimbal installed, as well as the additional plugin to support MechJeb, gut it still doesn't tip very much. I wind up having to do a fairly hefty orbital insertion burn (better than 1 km/s) at apoapsis...
Maybe the gimbals are locked? Try right-clicking on the engines and have a look.Usually, you can turn her quite nice. Ever tried flying her manually?
Gimbals are not locked, and yes, tried manual. Still handled like a brick, even with full control deflection. Engines are moving, so there's something else going on. I'll continue to experiment.

The fairings have interesting effects when I attempt to decouple them. I get two messages that say "Fairing cannot activate when stowed" and the extended PLF (side A) just seems to slide off. The other fairing (side B) just stayed there. Could there be any conflicts here with the old school fairings mod?

I also noticed the behavior of one fairing hanging while the other separated cleanly. Might be an issue of slight asymmetrical placement of the separation motors, or you need to be placed very closely prograde for a clean sep.

Separation motors? I probably forgot to put them on...but the "side b" fairing always hangs on top of the fairing base. 

That being said if you look at the fairing separation picture on the album in the OP it shows one fairing decoupling nicely and the other one hanging on the fairing base. 

Edited January 28, 2016 by Delta_8930

I look into the fairings. Normally, you need no extra separation motors, as the fairings have invisible ones already built in (invisible thrusters, invisible flame, no damage fx) to give the fairings a torgue while the decoupler force pushes them off. The real ones do this by spring loaded pushers, therefore i have these little helper engiens hidden.

EDIT: they don't miss a thing and decouple good on the ground. It might be that the fairing sep occurs too early in flight, when air density is still high enough to let the lift of the fairing overcome the separation force. Tried decoupling the fairing around 70000m after stage 3 is lit? Real world fairing sep occurs 16 seconds after vernier ignition, 13 seconds after stage2 separation in a height of around 123km.

Edited January 28, 2016 by InsaneDruid
I also had issues with in-flight jettison of the fairings while coasting at 75km. Motors fired, but they never detached from the fairing base.
